page.title: 17CUSWORTH VILLAGE
page.content: The estate of (Cuzeuuorde) dates back to Saxon Times & is mentioned in Domesday Survey of 1O86. During succeeding centuries - many owners. l669 purchased by Robert Wrightson of Hemsworth and remained in the same family, now Battie-Wrightson until l96l. Village is pretty hamlet nestling round the great hall (built l740) and overlooking the Don Valley. Just a small estate village for centuries until l93O, total population serving estate. Now village population is 2,2lO being housed in 3 separate estates - St. Martin's built in the l930's on old marshland, Lower Cusworth estate built in the l950's/60's & Upper Cusworth estate now under construction in l985.
